description: From flog +‎ -er. Compare Low German flogger (“a flail”).

examples: The High Masters were as shrewd floggers as any.

entries.meaning: (BDSM) A lightweight whip with multiple lashes.
(theater) A handle with strips of cloth attached, used for beating away charcoal dust etc.
examples: Schlepitchka is a texturing trick done by twirling a feather duster or flogger around gently and dabbing it on the surface of the scenery between each twirl of the tool so that the splayed pattern prints on the scenery.
